Route of CVRP

class solution.cvrp.route.RouteCvrp(route: List[problem.node.NodeWithCoord])
__getNeighboursSwapLong(proximity_swaps: int = 1, solution_evaluation: float = 0, route_cost: float = None) → List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int, str]]

getNeighboursSwapLong()

Method to get a customers swap of the route. The swaps will be made between 2 elements of the route depending of the parameter proximity_swaps. For exemple if the proximity_swaps is equal to 1, the route generated will be a swap between an element of the route and the node that is following. Let’s imagine we have route like (node 1 being the depot): [1, 2, 3, 4, 1] The swaps will be: [1, 3, 2, 4, 1] [1, 2, 4, 3, 1] [1, 4, 3, 2, 1]

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – The proximity of elements swaps, default to 1 (opt.)

  • solution_evaluation (float) – Evaluation of the solution (to then get the cost the whole solution), default to 0 (opt.)

  • route_cost (float) – Cost the route, default to None (opt.)

Returns

A tuple containing the routes with swaps, their evaluation (it will contain n route, with n being the number of customer in the route) and the string representing the swap realized

Return type

List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int, str]]

__getNeighboursSwapShort(proximity_swaps: int = 1, solution_evaluation: float = 0) → List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int, str]]

getNeighboursSwapShort()

Method to get a customers swap of the route. The swaps will be made between 2 elements of the route depending of the parameter proximity_swaps. For exemple if the proximity_swaps is equal to 1, the route generated will be a swap between an element of the route and the node that is following. Let’s imagine we have route like (node 1 being the depot): [1, 2, 3, 4, 1] The swaps will be: [1, 3, 2, 4, 1] [1, 2, 4, 3, 1] [1, 4, 3, 2, 1]

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – The proximity of elements swaps, default to 1 (opt.)

  • solution_evaluation (float) – Evaluation of the solution (to then get the cost the whole solution), default to 0 (opt.)

Returns

A tuple containing the routes with swaps, their evaluation (it will contain n route, with n being the number of customer in the route) and the string representing the swap realized

Return type

List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int, str]]

demandSupplied()

The sum of demand of all customers in the route

Returns

The total demand supplied by this route

Return type

int

drawPlotly()

Method to create the scatter that compose the graph made with plotly

Parameters

  • route_color (List[str]) – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

  • show_legend_node – Display or not the legend of nodes, default to False (opt.)

  • route_number (int) – Number of the route drawn

Returns

Two lists of scatters, one of nodes and one of edges

Return type

Tuple(List[Scatter], List[Scatter])

evaluation()

Method to get the cost of the route (not rounded)

Returns

The cost (the sum of all distance between the nodes of the route)

Return type

float

fromJSON()

Method to transform a JSON into an object

Parameters

json (dict) – Json data of the object

Raises

KeyValueError if the json is incomplete

getAllNeighboursSwap()

Method to get all customers swap possible of the route

Parameters

solution_evaluation (float) – Evaluation of the solution (to then get the cost the whole solution), default to 0 (opt.)

Returns

A tuple containing the routes with swaps and their evaluation

Return type

List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int]]

getNeighboursRouteInsertion()

Method to swap a customers between 2 routes

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – The proximity of elements swaps, default to 0 (opt.)

  • vehicule_capacity (int) – The capacity of the vehicule in the cvrp instance

  • solution_evaluation (float) – Evaluation of the solution (to then get the cost the whole solution), default to 0 (opt.)

  • self_route_cost (float) – cost of this route, default to None (opt.)

  • other_route_cost (float) – cost of the other route given in argument, default to None (opt.)

Returns

A tuple containing the routes with swaps and their evaluation (it will contain n route, with n being the number of customer in the route) and the string representing the swap realized

Return type

List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int, str]]

Exemple

>>> if len(route1) >= len(route2):
>>>     route1.getNeighboursRouteSwap(other_route=route2)
>>> else:
>>>     route2.getNeighboursRouteSwap(other_route=route1)
getNeighboursRouteSwap()

  • vehicule_capacity (int) – The capacity of the vehicule in the cvrp instance

Exemple

getNeighboursSwap()

Method to get a customers swap of the route. The swaps will be made between 2 elements of the route depending of the parameter proximity_swaps. For exemple if the proximity_swaps is equal to 1, the route generated will be a swap between an element of the route and the node that is following. Let’s imagine we have route like (node 1 being the depot): [1, 2, 3, 4, 1] The swaps will be: [1, 3, 2, 4, 1] [1, 2, 4, 3, 1] [1, 4, 3, 2, 1]

Parameters

  • proximity_swaps (int) – The proximity of elements swaps, default to 1 (opt.)

  • solution_evaluation (float) – Evaluation of the solution (to then get the cost the whole solution), default to 0 (opt.)

  • route_cost (float) – Cost the route, default to None (opt.)

Returns

A tuple containing the routes with swaps, their evaluation (it will contain n route, with n being the number of customer in the route) and the string representing the swap realized

Return type

List[Tuple[RouteCvrp, int, str]]

updateDrawPlotly()

Method to create the scatter that compose the graph made with plotly

Parameters

  • route_color (List[str]) – List of colors of the routes in the solution, default the DEFAULT_COLOR_PALETTE (utils.colorpallete) (opt.)

  • depot_node_color (str) – Color of the node depot, default to “#a6f68e” (opt.)

  • node_size (int) – Size of the nodes, default to 15 (opt)

  • show_legend_edge (bool) – Display or not the legend of edges, default to True (opt.)

  • show_legend_node – Display or not the legend of nodes, default to False (opt.)

  • route_number (int) – Number of the route drawn

  • node_scatter_parent (List[go.Scatter]) – List of node scatter of the main figure animation

  • edge_scatter_parent (List[go.Scatter]) – List of edge scatter of the main figure animation
